name: Westin Dubai Mina Seyahi Beach Resort & Marina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked the Westin on recommendation from a friend who has been living and working in Dubai for the last 6 years and we were not disappointed. This hotel is beautiful inside and out, situated right on the beach with attentive and friendly staff. The grounds are beautifully manicured and the pool is fantastic with two swim up bars and a section reserved for adults only. We stayed in a sea view club room and it was worth the extra $. The room was huge with a large balcony overlooking the water with a view of the palm in the distance. Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was luxurious. The food was fantastic and the 6pm complimentary drinks were well received while watching the sunset from the club lounge. We both used the spa service and thoroughly enjoyed our massages. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The hotel and resort are fabulous. In fact, I cannot fault the facilities and location. What makes me give this hotel a poor rating s this : -The one thing, which really lets this hotel down, is the sneaky practice of Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC), which is in operation at the Food and Beverage outlets.
reviews.title: Dynamic Currency Conversion in operation here

reviews.text: Sales slips states, “I accept that I have been offered the choice of currencies for payment and this choice is final. I accept the conversion rate offered………. “
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, what the staff are doing is presenting you with the chip and pin terminal and they have selected your home currency to pay with. Thus, giving you no choice.. They then tell you and tell you it’s better to pay in GBP (or whatever your home currency is) which is not always the case.
reviews.title: Almost excellent

reviews.text: I had to ask for a Manager to void the transaction on several occasions. Basically, if they try and trick you and you do not want to pay in Pounds, Dollars or anything other than AED..DO NOT sign any slips or DO NOT enter your PIN number. Just refuse.
reviews.title: Visited for Friday brunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Management know what the practice is. I suspect the staff are trained to do this as I experienced this problem is several bars. It’s a shame. Luckily, they do not enforce this practice at the reception desk for settling bills.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay!

reviews.text: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel (previously bringing our 2 young children). On arrival service was immaculate and to top it off, although we would have been very happy with the executive room we had booked, we found we had been upgraded to a fabulous suite - amazing - truly a home from home!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, fabulous service, exceptional food - lush!!

reviews.text: Lovely 'adult only' area by the pool, where service again could not be faulted - cocktails on your sun lounger - heaven!

reviews.text: Having said that, the children's pool is also excellent , with a sun shade over it - our kids loved it last time.

reviews.text: Food in the evening at the Italian themed restaurant was fabulous.
reviews.title: Feb half term holiday with the Kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was exceptional - the best French toast I've ever had and the complimentary afternoon tea ( yummy!) and the evening drinks are a really great touch that make this hotel fantastic value for money.
reviews.title: RELAX,RELAX,RELAX

reviews.text: I have just returned from my 8 day stay in the Westin. I would like to encourage all families, couples and business travellers to this hotel. It caters for everyone. I stayed in a Deluxe room with my wife and two children. The room was a great size. We went to the Blue Orange buffet restaurant most evenings and the food catered for every dietary requirement, The swimming pools were beautiful and there were life guards every 10 meters which made me feel at ease with my kids swimming. The staff were so attentive to all our needs and so pilot. The location is superb to get about to all the attractions. When I return, the Westin has made my life a lot easier as I don't have to look for hotels, I will return to the Westin without question.
reviews.title: What a stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and i have just returned from holidaying in Dubai and the Maldives and all i can say is that the Westin took the crown. The whole overall experience we had was just sheer class. A pleasure to stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone. Great food excellent service what more can i say just amazing.
